definition: croton (Croton tiglium), evergreen bush of Euphorbiaceae family 大戟科[da4 ji3 ke1]/croton seed, a strong purgative
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Croton, genus of evergreen bush of Euphorbiaceae family 大戟科[da4 ji3 ke1]
croton bush (Croton tiglium), evergreen bush of Euphorbiaceae family 大戟科[da4 ji3 ke1], with seed having strong purgative properties
bark of Croton tiglium used as purgative

sentences.english: It was used for catalytic oxidation of crotonic aldehyde to crotonic acid.
sentences.chinese: 綜述了巴豆醛催化氧化合成巴豆酸的研究進展。

sentences.english: It was used for catalytic oxidation of crotonic aldehyde to crotonic acid.
sentences.chinese: 綜述了巴豆醛催化氧化合成巴豆酸的研究進展。

sentences.english: Conclusion: Among the six ingredient of Croton oil, The 5th part has the best effect on killing Mycobacterium tuberculosis in vitro.
sentences.chinese: 巴豆油抗結核分枝桿菌作用的主要成分爲第5組份。

sentences.english: It is said ten drops of croton, taken internally, will have fatal results.
sentences.chinese: 據說攝入十滴巴豆油會致死。

sentences.english: The synthesis development of crotonic acid by oxidation of crotonaldehyde was reviewed.
sentences.chinese: 綜述了巴豆醛催化氧化合成巴豆酸的研究進展。

definition: dried fruit of immature citron or trifoliate orange (used in TCM)
Chinese goldthread (Coptis chinensis), rhizome used in medicine
